abstract: JPMorgan Chase, which agreed to buy some businesses of RBS Sempra Commodities, chose not to acquire the the North American gas and power trading operations because it did not want to share control of it with Sempra Energy, according to several people familiar with the negotiations.
snippet: JPMorgan Chase, which agreed to buy some businesses of RBS Sempra Commodities, chose not to acquire the the North American gas and power trading operations because it did not want to share control of it with Sempra Energy, according to several peo...
lead_paragraph: Control, not politics, may have been the biggest factor in why JPMorgan Chase chose not to acquire the the North American gas and power trading operations owned by a joint venture of the Royal Bank of Scotland and Sempra Energy of California. Sempra seemed unwilling to surrender full control of those operations and JPMorgan did not want to share a large chunk of the business with Sempra, according to several people familiar with the negotiations who asked not to be identified because of the sensitivity of the talks.

headline.main: Behind JPMorgan’s Deal With RBS Sempra
